EXPERIENCE.Company Name: D. E. SHAW INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Design and Implementation of Service Oriented Middleware for Service Oriented Computing In Mobile Pervasive Environment
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:
Objective of the project is to design a self organized system for service oriented computing ( SOC ) in mobile pervasive environment using where the quality of service ( QoS ) of all users will always be maintained with enhanced service availability . Mobility of server and client should not affect the services. Failure should be recovered as early as possible and requirements should be fulfilled using minimum amount of resources. 
I am involved with a research group in the Department of Information Technology, NIT Durgapur and currently working on the aforesaid project as a programmer. My role in this project is to simulate and implement the algorithms suggested by the research group in Java Agent Development Environment (JADE) and Android.

This project aims to study the performance of the algorithms emperically. Randomized version of the algorithm is used to get rid of the various idiosyncrasies in an arbitrary version and also to calculate the time 	complexity of the algorithms analytically.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Migration from Cognos to Java for generation of FAS reports
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: The aim of this project is to build the groundwork for the migration from Cognos framework to Java for the generation of reports in Excel format using Apache POI. The reports can also be downloaded and it supports grouping of data which leads to better analysis.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: An Adaptive and Scalable Service Oriented Emulator for Internet of Things
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: In this work, we propose an adaptive and scalable emulator for the IoT environment. Most of the existing simulators and/or emulators are not flexible in nature and their inherent limitations make them partially inefficient. This emulator is based on the service oriented architecture and all the functionalities related to it is loosely coupled, which helps the researcher to explore and/or manipulate the particular functionality on which they are working. Furthermore for evaluating the functionality of the emulator we have emulated a set of server selection and service replication schemes for different IoT scenarios in Python and have compared the results. The proposed server selection and replication schemes clearly outperforms the existing schemes for the same.
